Comments: Arrived in France on the Queen and Invicta 27 Officers 802 Men
Hot march, several men fell out
Spent several days training, familiarization with trenches
Rotated in Trenches with 9th Essex. Rest Area.
Moved up to support losing effort in the Battle of Loos
In the trenches in front of the Chalk Pits
Attacked and held German Trenches. Heavy Casualties. (36C.G.5.d.8.1)
150 Casualties from attack. Rest and reorganize in Support Trench (former British Front Line)
Moved up to counter German counterattack.
Back into the line junction of Crown and Big Willie Trenches
Started to relieve 9th Essex. Enemy shelling as Battalion crossed open Ground.  58 Casualties including Death of Walter Goodfellow
Reserve Area for Rest and Training
